title: 250th Anniversary of the Founding of the United States Army
summary:
The document is a proclamation by President Donald J. Trump commemorating the 250th anniversary of the founding of the United States Army on June 14, 2025. It reflects on the Army's historical significance, tracing its origins back to the Second Continental Congress in 1775, which established the Continental Army amidst the Revolutionary War. The proclamation honors the Army's legacy of valor and service in defending American freedom throughout history, from pivotal battles like Saratoga and Gettysburg to modern military engagements.

Key highlights include the President's commitment to maintaining a strong military by removing what he describes as "sinister ideologies" from its ranks and reinstating service members dismissed for refusing the COVID vaccine. He emphasizes a renewed focus on military recruitment and a foreign policy of "peace through strength." The proclamation culminates in a tribute to those who sacrificed for the nation, affirming a dedication to preserving the legacy of courage and freedom. Overall, it serves as a rallying call to honor the Army's past while ensuring its continued strength and relevance in the future.
